issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
org.apache.mahout.text.SequenceFilesFromMailArchivesTest seems to be platform-dependent in assertion (path comparisons). Assertion fails on Windows

stack trace: 
Test set: org.apache.mahout.text.SequenceFilesFromMailArchivesTest
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.144
sec <<< FAILURE!
testMain(org.apache.mahout.text.SequenceFilesFromMailArchivesTest)
Time elapsed: 0.14 sec  <<< FAILURE!
org.junit.ComparisonFailure:
expected:<TEST[/subdir/mail-messages.gz/]user@example.com> but
was:<TEST[\subdir\mail-messages.gz\]user@example.com>
       at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:123)
       at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:145)

introduced with commit :

commit 86e6e1d64901cc0ce436d43a56fcadb8a2cb6c1d
Author: Grant Ingersoll <gsingers@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Mar 25 14:39:25 2011 +0000

comments.body: Looks like an easy fix -- along the way cleaned up some things about this test and a few other tests.
Thanks Sean. (you're too fast for me ):)

Integrated in Mahout-Quality #717 (See [https://hudson.apache.org/hudson/job/Mahout-Quality/717/])
    MAHOUT-649 fix small platform-specific file path problem in test
